subclassFeature.name: Path of the Experiment: Alchemical Experiments
entries: You gain a set of {@item alchemist's supplies|phb}, and you have proficiency with it.
Over the course of a long rest, you can use your Alchemist’s Supplies to create a {@item potion of healing|phb} if you have the necessary components.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Experiment: Volatile Serum
entries: When you enter a Rage, volatile serum floods your body. Choose one of the following serums; the effect lasts until your Rage ends. You can choose a different serum each time you Rage.

entries.name: Ferocity
entries: Your speed isn’t reduced by difficult terrain.
When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack, you can move up to half your speed as part of the same action.

entries.name: Monstrosity
entries: Your reach increases by 5 feet.
If you make a Strength-based melee attack and miss, add your Rage Damage bonus to the total for the purpose of any effects that trigger on a hit (the attack still misses).
If there is space, you count as Large for the purpose of grapple and shove attempts.

entries.name: Reconstruction
entries: At the start of each of your turns, you can spend one Hit Die to regain hit points equal to the roll + your Constitution modifier. Any excess becomes temporary hit points that vanish when your Rage ends.
While this serum is active, you have vulnerability to acid and fire damage.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Experiment: Improved Serums
entries: Your serums evolve. When you choose a serum via Volatile Serum, you also gain its corresponding upgrade:

entries.name: Ferocity — Corrosive Expulsion
entries: As an action (or as part of the bonus action to enter your Rage), expel corrosive fumes in a 15-foot cone or 30-foot line (your choice).

Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus), taking acid damage equal to your Rage Damage × d8 on a failed save, or half as much on a success.
Once per Rage.

entries.name: Monstrosity — Blindside Stomp
entries: When you hit with a melee weapon attack, you can force the target to make a Strength saving throw (DC as above) or be knocked prone.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Reconstruction — Venting Carapace
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to deal acid damage equal to your Constitution modifier + your Rage Damage.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Experiment: Hardened Physiology
entries: You gain resistance to poison damage and advantage on saving throws against being poisoned.
When you finish a short rest, you can remove one of the following conditions affecting you: blinded, deafened, poisoned, or one level of exhaustion (once per short or long rest).

subclassFeature.name: Path of the Experiment: Apex Compound
entries: When you enter a Rage, you can apply an apex dose to supercharge your chosen serum for 1 minute:

entries.name: Ferocity
entries: Your movement doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks.

When you move through a creature’s space, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC = 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus) or fall prone and take bludgeoning damage equal to your Rage Damage.

entries.name: Monstrosity
entries: Your reach increases by an additional 5 feet (total +10 feet).
When you hit a creature with a melee attack, you can force it to make a Strength saving throw (DC as above) or be grappled (escape DC equal to the save DC) until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Reconstruction
entries: You can spend up to two Hit Dice at the start of each of your turns and add your Barbarian level to the total restored.
While this apex is active, you are immune to the poisoned condition.

subclassFeature.name: College of Whistles: Whistle Companions
entries: As a bonus action, you summon spectral, musical companions that occupy your space for 1 minute.
Choose one effect when summoned (you can choose a different one each time):

items: You gain advantage on Charisma (Performance) and Charisma (Persuasion) checks.
As a reaction, impose disadvantage on one creature’s next attack against you (before the start of your next turn).
You can give Bardic Inspiration as part of the same bonus action.

entries: Uses: PB per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: College of Whistles: Whistled Cantrips
entries: You learn the {@spell gust} and {@spell minor illusion} cantrips; they count as Bard spells for you.

subclassFeature.name: College of Whistles: Piercing Trill
entries: As an action, creatures in a 15-foot cone that can hear you must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or be {@condition charmed} by you until the end of your next turn.
Hostile creatures have disadvantage on the save if affected by your Whistle Companions this round.
Once per long rest, or expend a 3rd-level or higher spell slot to use again.

subclassFeature.name: College of Whistles: Chorus of Echoes
entries: When you use Bardic Inspiration on an ally, another ally of your choice within 30 feet also gains a die of Bardic Inspiration (once per turn).
Your Whistle Companions no longer require concentration and persist their full duration while you concentrate on a Bard spell.

subclassFeature.name: Harvest Domain: Blessing of the Field
entries: As an action, bless a 10-foot-radius area of ground for 1 hour; allies in the area gain a bonus to Wisdom (Survival) checks and saving throws against being {@condition frightened} equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum +1).
Uses: PB per long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Harvest Domain: Channel Divinity — Harvest
entries: As an action, present your holy symbol to either nurture or scour: either heal creatures of your choice in a 30-foot radius for 2d6 + your Cleric level, or force creatures of your choice in a 30-foot radius to make a Constitution saving throw or take 2d6 + your Cleric level necrotic or radiant damage (your choice).

subclassFeature.name: Harvest Domain: Reaper’s Aegis
entries: When a creature you can see within 30 feet drops to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to grant another creature within 30 feet temporary hit points equal to your Cleric level + your Wisdom modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Harvest Domain: Blessed Harvest
entries: When you or an ally within 30 feet rolls a Hit Die, add your Wisdom modifier to the total.

subclassFeature.name: Harvest Domain: Sheaf of Plenty
entries: After a long rest, create a number of magical sheaves equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum 1).

As a bonus action, you or a creature within 30 feet can expend a sheaf to heal 1d4 + your Wisdom modifier hit points or to deal 1d4 + your Wisdom modifier radiant damage on the next weapon hit before the end of its next turn.
